oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Monuments; Trees
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Davis, Sam, 1842-1863; Zolnay, George Julian, 1862 or 3-1949; Nashville (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Postcard featuring color image of the memorial statue of Sam Davis. The statue depicts Sam Davis standing with his arms crossed atop a stone monument with a bronze inscription.
The Sam Davis Statue was created by sculptor George Julian Zolnay and unveiled in 1909. It had been produced at the urging of Sumner Archibald Cunningham, editor of the Confederate Veteran magazine.
